text: Connecting people and data to improve lives
label: BODY

text: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
label: BODY

text: (OCHA) is establishing a Centre for Humanitarian Data in the Netherlands.
label: BODY

text: It will be operational by early 2017 for an initial three years.
label: BODY

text: The Centre’s mission is to increase the use and impact of data in the
label: BODY

text: humanitarian sector. The vision is to create a future where all people
label: BODY

text: involved in a humanitarian situation have access to the data they need,
label: BODY

text: when and how they need it, to make responsible and informed decisions.
label: BODY

text: The Centre will support humanitarian partners and OCHA staff in the field
label: BODY

text: and at headquarters with their data efforts. It will be part of the city of The
label: BODY

text: Hague’s Humanity Hub, a dedicated building for organizations working
label: BODY

text: on data and innovation in the social sector. The location offers OCHA and
label: BODY

text: partners a new, neutral setting where a hybrid culture can be created
label: BODY

text: to end need. The Centre’s activities will accelerate the changes required

text: for the humanitarian system to become data driven.
